intro: Sisymbrium orientale var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the smoothpod wild radish, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed and alternate upper leaves that are linear to lanceolate. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces smooth, elongated pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
